intro: Pycnocephalum scapigerum, commonly known as the dense-headed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its thick, hairy stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds.
